title: Does this support animated SVGs?
body:
Please let me know.

Thank you very much in advance for helping me out.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Not at this time. Right now, the SVG is converted to a `SKPicture` as it is parsed - which is a static drawing.

comments.author: quakeulf
comments.body:
Ok, thank you for letting me know.

However, it still seems according to the demo that animations work and that the syntax for determining the shapes are interchangeable with SVGs. At least interpolation between four differently shaped objects work, so I am guessing colour change, rotation, scale and position will work too.

comments.author: MinkyuKang
comments.body: Do you have plan to support this?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Not in the near future. The interpolation example, (https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp.Extended/tree/master/SkiaSharp.Extended#skpathinterpolation) is totally separate and is just basic interpolation between two `SKPath` objects through the use of a new path. The animation is then done via a stepping manually through all the paths in the draw method.
